alert.note: Alert for Alamosa; Costilla; Huerfano (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 08 at 3:46PM MST until December 08 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Eastern Alamosa County in southeastern Colorado... West central Huerfano County in southeastern Colorado... Northeastern Costilla County in south central Colorado... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 346 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 7 miles southeast of San Luis Lake, or 13 miles northeast of Alamosa, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Western Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, Great Sand Dunes, and Blanca Peak. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
